title: What technology is making IRDA ports obsolete? - Quora

response.answer_text: IrDA ports employ infrared communications over short distances to allow various devices to inter-connect. This used to be a standard modality for portable printers to access laptops. It has largely been superseded by BlueTooth technology, which uses radio signals for much the same purpose. Not only does this extend the range, it improves the bandwidth and no longer need be explicitly line-of-sight.
